course_title: Topics in Afr American Studies: Black Mathematics
class_notes:
(Same as PHIL 385 2)
(This course examines black engagement with mathematical fields (such as statistics, calculus, set theory) and mathematical concepts (such as infinity, multiplicity, algorithms, and negation). Rather than focusing on calculation, we will read mathematics as a theoretical enterprise impacting black life. This course imagines what a "black philosophy of mathematics" might entail.)
course_description: This course explores one of a wide range of topics pertaining to the African American experience in the fields of human and civil rights, social and literary texts, and the social sciences.
sections: Class Nbr: 3217, Section #: 5, Type: LEC, Campus: ATL, Meets: TTh 4-5:15p, Instructor: C. Warren, Status: Open
